column2: CONNECTICUT DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 2. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 3. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: No, never.

column2: 4. If the roadway is wet, you should:
column8: maintain the same speed.

column2: 5. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column6: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 6. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

column2: 7. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column8: Slow down.

column2: 9. When you see pedestrians near the road, you should:
column4: speed up to clear the area quickly.
column6: sound your horn and maintain your current speed.
column8: slow down and pass with caution.

column2: 10. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column8: Yield.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Lane ends

column2: 13. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column6: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column8: the speed limit is increased at night.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column6: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear
column8: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way

column2: 16. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column8: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

column2: 17. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 18. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column6: slow down to allow traffic to enter.
column8: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.

column2: 19. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column6: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 20. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column8: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 21. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.
column8: increase as vehicle speed increases.

column2: 22. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column6: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 23. On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
column8: vehicles.

column2: 24. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: 30 minutes.

column2: 25. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: All of the above.
